intro: Kalonymus leiophloea, commonly known as the smooth-leaved kalonymus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
